cscd211Game.Classes

Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd211Game.Classes.Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    The Deck class - A Deck is comprised of a private Card [] reference and a private count to indicate where we are at in the deck These references hold the appropriate Card object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Card[] cards
      The private data member to represent this Card [] cards
      private int count
      The private data member to represent this int count

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Deck(Card[] cards)
      Explicit Value Constructor for a Deck.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCount()
      The getCount returns the count of the played cards from the deck
      Card getNextCard()
      The getNextCard returns the next card on the top of the deck
      int getTotalCards()
      The getTotalCards method returns the number of cards in the deck
      void resetDeck()
      The resetDeck method resets the deck as if it were a brand new deck.
      void shuffle(int times)
      The shuffle method random shuffles the cards the number of times of the int passed in This must be done as random and generic as possible, meaning if a new Suit or Value is added to the enumerated type you will not need to update this method.
      java.lang.String toString()
      The Deck toString method

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deck

        public Deck(Card[] cards)
        Explicit Value Constructor for a Deck.
        Parameters:
        cards - Representing an array of Cards passed in from the outside world

        NOTE: You will generate a new array within the constructor. You will then generate new cards from the old array -- You will not just blindly assign the reference to the class level reference or do a shallow copy with Arrays or clone
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the array being passed in is null

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The Deck toString method
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String - The individual cards one per line

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle(int times)
        The shuffle method random shuffles the cards the number of times of the int passed in This must be done as random and generic as possible, meaning if a new Suit or Value is added to the enumerated type you will not need to update this method.
        Parameters:
        times - Representing the number of times to shuffle the deck
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the times variable is less than 1

      • resetDeck

        public void resetDeck()
        The resetDeck method resets the deck as if it were a brand new deck. You must call your selectionSort method from ArrayUtils.

      • getNextCard

        public Card getNextCard()
        The getNextCard returns the next card on the top of the deck
        Returns:
        Card - Representing the next card on the top of the deck the card is determined by count

      • getTotalCards

        public int getTotalCards()
        The getTotalCards method returns the number of cards in the deck
        Returns:
        int - Representing the total cards in the deck

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        The getCount returns the count of the played cards from the deck
        Returns:
        int - Representing the number of cards that have been dealt from the deck
